title.rendered: Mumbai vs Delhi, India Women’s League 2023: Today’s Match Preview, Fantasy Cricket Team

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on the recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable XIs

Mumbai: Hayley Matthews, Yastika Bhatia (wk), Nat Sciver-Brunt, Harmanpreet Kaur (c), Amelia Kerr, Issy Wong, Amanjot Kaur/Pooja Vastrakar, Humaira Kazi, Dhara Gujjar, Jintimani Kalita, Saika Ishaque

Delhi: Meg Lanning (c), Shafali Verma, Alice Capsey, Jemimah Rodrigues, Marizanne Kapp, Jess Jonassen, Taniya Bhatia (wk), Arundhati Reddy, Radha Yadav, Shikha Pandey, Poonam Yadav

Pitch Report

Venue: Dr DY Patil Sports Academy, Navi Mumbai

(Based on the last three games)

1st innings average score: 137

2nd innings average score: 146

Wickets per innings: 6

Type: Good for batting

Wins

Batting 1st: —

Batting 2nd: 100%

Also Read:

India vs Australia, 3rd ODI: Fantasy Team, Probable Playing XIs, Pitch Report & Fantasy Tips

Fantasy Tips of The Day

Harmanpreet Kaur is the only player to slam three half-centuries in this tournament, owing to which her selection percentage for the last six games hasn’t dropped below 86.

Marizanne Kapp has garnered bonus points for crossing the 30-run mark on three occasions. Moreover, her best figures of five for 15 came at the DY Patil Sports Academy.

Meg Lanning and Shikha Pandey have also enjoyed their time at the venue. While Meg has collected 149 runs at 50, Shikha has picked consecutive three-fors.

Given her audacious approach at the top, it has been all or nothing for Shafali Verma. Nonetheless, she is the second-highest six-hitter (11) in the league and has generated 43 bonus points only through boundary-hitting.

Besides inflicting eight dismissals, Yastika Bhatia has collected 158 runs at an impressive average of 27.

Alice Capsey (87 runs, three wickets, two catches, and a run out) is the only player from either side to feature in the Best11 for the last five games.

When these teams locked horns earlier in the league, Hayley Matthews (32 runs, three wickets, and a catch) and Saika Ishaque (three wickets) were the captain and vice-captain of the Best11 respectively.

In the same match, Issy Wong bagged a three-for. Overall, she has taken six wickets in the tournament.

After six games, Radha Yadav has only a wicket to show for her efforts. However, her five catches (the most in the season) have provided some respite to fantasy players.
